title: Did Leonardo da Vinci have kids? - Quora

response.answer_text: No he never married or had children, the only thing regarding sex in his notebooks One of the few references that Leonardo made to sexuality in his notebooks states: "The act of procreation and anything that has any relation to it is so disgusting that human beings would soon die out if there were no pretty faces and sensuous dispositions." This statement has been the subject of various extrapolations and interpretations in attempts to gain a picture of his sexuality. The only historical document concerning Leonardo's sexual life is an accusation of sodomy made in 1476, while he was still at the workshop of Verrocchio. They say because of this charge taken to court, he maintained a life of celibacy, according to his long time friend and art patron, Elizabeth Abbott, in her History of Celibacy, contends that, although Leonardo was probably homosexual, the trauma of the sodomy case converted him to celibacy for the rest of his life. A similar view of a homosexually-inclined but chaste Leonardo appears in a famous 1910 paper by Sigmund Freud, Leonardo da Vinci, A Memory of His Childhood, which analysed a memory Leonardo described of having been attacked as a baby by a bird of prey that opened his mouth and "stuck me with the tail inside my lips again and again". Freud claimed the symbolism was clearly phallic, but argued that Leonardo's homosexuality was latent: that he did not act on his desires.
No. And it’s quite likely that he was gay. See: Was Leonardo da Vinci gay?

It is reasonably certain that he did not. His notebooks do not contain any references. He was an illegitimate son and was twice accused of homosexuality which during the Renaissance could be a capital offense.
